channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report E-2023030730
item.description:
Report E-2023030730

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T14:00:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-23
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Southeastern Freight Lines Inc
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the unloading phase of a trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made with the bottom side of the pail putting a 2.5 inch puncture in the pail. All material leaked from the pail. All spillage of material was confined to the immediate area for cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2023030710
item.description:
Report E-2023030710

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-28
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NWN experienced a release of UN2735 "Dabco T" from (2) 55-gallon metal drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the trailer & dock floor due to faulty leaking seams. The drums were each placed into a 95-gallon poly over pack. Absorbent were deployed and worked into the impacted areas then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023031176
item.description:
Report X-2023031176

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-22
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT. THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE FLOOR WITH THE BOTTOM WET. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, THE PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED.

item.title: Report E-2023030705
item.description:
Report E-2023030705

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-28
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NCH experienced a release of UN3495 Iodine from a 100.5-pound fiber drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed that approximately ½ a pound of product released to a 2’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor. The fiber drum was punctured by a forklift blade. All released material along with the damaged drum was collected and containerized into a 55-gallon plastic drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023030998
item.description:
Report X-2023030998

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-17
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA AND IT WAS DISCOVERED IT WAS LEAKING AFTER SITTING OVERNIGHT. PKG DID NOT LEAK ON ANYTHING ELSE. IT WAS CONTAINED BY ITSELF IN A SECURE LOCATION. PKG WAS THEN PROCESSED AS A DAMAGE. DescribePack: IT APPEARS THERE WAS A SMALL LEAK IN THE BODY OR THE CLOSURE CAP OF THE 5-GALLON BAG. UNSURE ON HOW THE LEAK HAPPENED. UNSURE HOW MUCH LEAKED OUT BUT IT WAS ENOUGH TO SOAK THE BOX. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS ALREADY IN A HAZMAT BAG WHILE BEING HELD. IT WAS THEN PLACED INTO A HAZMAT DRUM FOR BETTER SECLUSION.

item.title: Report X-2023030971
item.description:
Report X-2023030971

  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler reported leaking package once it arrived to designated loading area to QA. QA inspected package and the contents were leaking. DescribePack: Package found wet on the bottom of fiberboard box. Metal cans crushed and dented. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Liquid absorbed into outer packaging of cardboard box.

item.title: Report X-2023030962
item.description:
Report X-2023030962

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-14
  • City: WHITSETT
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was showing signs of internal leakage of white paint. Spill occurred around 7:30 am, to which the package was removed from the work area and placed in a black bin to contain any leakage. DescribePack: failure had occurred from having loose cap lids which caused the paint to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a black bin and removed from the work area so that no other packages would be damaged from the paint spill.

item.title: Report X-2023020662
item.description:
Report X-2023020662

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-10
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED AT QA FROM THE UNLOAD AND THERE WAS VISIBLE DAMAGE ON ONE SIDE OF THE BOX AS IF THERE WAS LEAKING INSIDE THE BOX. IT WAS ALSO SITTING ON ITS SIDE. UNSURE IF THATS HOW IT WAS FOUND OR IF IT WAS PLACED THAT WAY TO AVOID THE WET SIDE OF THE BOX TO TOUCH ANYTHING ELSE. PKG WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT DRUM ONCE IT WAS PROCESSED AND SECURED. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTING IT APPEARS A CAP WAS LOOSE AND THAT IS THE CAUSE OF THE BOX BEING WET AND CORRODED. NO OTHER ISSUES WITH THE PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS PLACED UPRIGHT AND INNER JUGS WERE INSPECTED TO MAKE SURE THERE WERE NO HOLES IN THEM THAT WOULD HAVE CAUSED THE LEAKAGE. BOX WAS THEN PLACED IN THE HAZMAT DRUM AND SECURED.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being loaded and was improperly handled, causing the closures of the paint cans to loosen and the contents to spill out inside of the package. Hazmat was brought to QA's attention and was placed in QA area. DescribePack: Closures of paint cans loosened and the contents spilled out inside of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to QA Hazmat area for examination/processing and to prevent further damage.

Upon inspection on 2/6/23 caps on can were found to be loose and the gasoline leaked all over boxed and soaked into the outer packaging. DescribePack: Package caps on cans of gasoline were loose and all 4 cans leaked and soaked onto box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a plastic bag upon realization of leak and then into a yellow dum.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: During sort operations at the Greensboro facility a fiberboard box was found leaking. While investigating the package spill agents discovered two jerrycans of UN1263, paint related materials, 3. There were no dangerous goods markings or labels on the packaging, and no Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. The involved package is being held pending further disposition.
